cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across eastern and central Cuba tonight, emerging into the Florida Straits Monday, then lifting northward along the eastern Gulf and paralleling the west coast of Florida before curving inland over the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay area

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas (Florida Keys)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for Jamaica and much of eastern-central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula (greatest impact along the west coast) and portions of the southeast U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low–moderate chance (≤15%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds, higher chance of brief gusts especially Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation up to 1–2 ft possible along exposed Atlantic beaches, mainly during high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated 6 inches; risk of brief urban/flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-period squalls lowering visibility and affecting vessel handling.
